meanings.definition: Of or relating to teaching or instruction.
meanings.sent1: The tuitional materials helped the students understand the lesson better.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's tuitional approach was effective in engaging the class.
meanings.sent3: The tuitional methods used in the science experiment made it more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her tuitional style was like a guiding light for the struggling students.
meanings.sent5: The tuitional guidance provided by the mentor was invaluable to the new teachers.

meanings.sent1: The tuitional video explained the concept clearly.
meanings.sent2: The tutor's tuitional support helped the student improve.
meanings.sent3: His tuitional advice on fishing was surprisingly helpful.
meanings.sent4: The tuitional voice in her head urged her to take the risk.
meanings.sent5: The tuitional feedback from the coach motivated the team to do better.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to tuition or fees for instruction.
meanings.sent1: The tuitional costs for the course were reasonable.
meanings.sent2: The university's tuitional policies were clearly outlined.
meanings.sent3: She found a tuitional loophole that saved her money on classes.
meanings.sent4: The tuitional burden of student loans weighed heavily on her.
